name: demo2win
description: A demo delivery framework emphasizing clear openings, Tell–Show–Tell, interactivity, and value-linked closings

components.name: Opening & Context Setting
components.description: Set the stage with a crisp, relevant opening that aligns to audience and meeting purpose

subComponents.name: Opening Hook
subComponents.description: Compelling, customer-centric reason to pay attention now

scoringCriteria.excellent: Opens with a concise, audience-relevant hook tied to business context within 60 seconds
scoringCriteria.good: Clear opening that states purpose and relevance
scoringCriteria.fair: Basic intro with limited relevance to audience
scoringCriteria.poor: No clear opening; dives straight into features

coachingTips: State the purpose and promised outcomes in one sentence
Name the personas and what they'll get from this demo
Avoid housekeeping monologues and small talk drift

subComponents.name: Relevance Framing
subComponents.description: Tailor expectations for what will and won't be covered and why

scoringCriteria.excellent: Clear scope with explicit inclusions/exclusions mapped to stakeholder goals
scoringCriteria.good: Shares a focused agenda with stated priorities
scoringCriteria.fair: Agenda present but generic; light tailoring

coachingTips: Frame the agenda as benefits, not topics

components.name: Persona Alignment & Discovery Recap
components.description: Confirm prior discovery and align to stakeholder outcomes

subComponents.name: Stakeholder Objectives Recap
subComponents.description: Restate who's in the room and what each needs

scoringCriteria.excellent: Concise, role-based recap that each stakeholder confirms as accurate
scoringCriteria.good: Recap covers main buyer group and goals
scoringCriteria.fair: Partial recap; misses some personas or nuance

coachingTips: Use role-language (CFO vs. Admin) when recapping
Tie each objective to a later demo segment

subComponents.name: Success Criteria Recap
subComponents.description: Confirm decision criteria and acceptance tests for 'good'

scoringCriteria.excellent: Specific, prioritized criteria confirmed with owners and measurement
scoringCriteria.fair: Criteria implied but not explicit or owned

coachingTips: Name the criterion, owner, and metric
Park new criteria for validation later

components.name: Storyline & Agenda Control
components.description: Maintain a simple storyline and control timing throughout

subComponents.name: Agenda Agreement
subComponents.description: Gain explicit buy-in to the flow

scoringCriteria.excellent: Agenda gains explicit consent and links to value for each section

coachingTips: Link each agenda item to a stakeholder outcome

subComponents.name: Time Management & Pacing
subComponents.description: Keep segments tight; finish on time

scoringCriteria.excellent: Each segment time-boxed; finishes with a buffer and recap
scoringCriteria.good: Minor slippage but overall on time

components.name: Tell–Show–Tell Execution
components.description: Apply the core Demo2Win technique to every segment

subComponents.name: First Tell (Setup)
subComponents.description: Preview what they're about to see and why it matters

scoringCriteria.excellent: Sets clear intent and business relevance in ≤30 seconds
scoringCriteria.good: States what and why with reasonable clarity

coachingTips: Keep to one sentence: What + Why

subComponents.name: Show (Execution)
subComponents.description: Demonstrate the workflow concisely without tangents

scoringCriteria.excellent: Short, clean path aligned to the scenario with zero dead-ends

coachingTips: Narrate steps at a business level

subComponents.name: Final Tell (Value Reinforcement)
subComponents.description: Translate what they saw into measurable value and next step

scoringCriteria.excellent: Summarizes outcome in customer terms with a metric or risk removed

components.name: Scenario-Based Flow & Transitions
components.description: Organize around real customer scenarios with smooth signposting

subComponents.name: Scenario Selection
subComponents.description: Pick the fewest, highest-impact scenarios

scoringCriteria.excellent: 1-3 priority scenarios map directly to success criteria
scoringCriteria.fair: Too many or loosely relevant scenarios

coachingTips: Tie each to a decision criterion

subComponents.name: Transitions & Signposting
subComponents.description: Make it obvious where you are and why it matters

scoringCriteria.excellent: Clear verbal signposts link sections and value

coachingTips: Use a simple section bumper slide
Preview the 'why' of the next section

components.name: Interactivity & Control
components.description: Engage the audience while retaining demo control

subComponents.name: Check-ins & Pauses
subComponents.description: Invite short feedback loops

scoringCriteria.excellent: Frequent, precise check-ins that surface insight without derailing

coachingTips: Capture follow-ups in a parking lot

subComponents.name: Handling Interruptions
subComponents.description: Acknowledge, contain, and redirect gracefully

scoringCriteria.excellent: Uses acknowledge-clarify-redirect; maintains flow and rapport

components.name: Proof & Evidence
components.description: Support claims with relevant proof and de-risk concerns

subComponents.name: Relevant Proof Points
subComponents.description: Use customer-like data, references, or metrics

scoringCriteria.excellent: Proof tied to scenarios and personas with quantified outcomes

subComponents.name: Risk & Objection Handling
subComponents.description: Preempt and address common risks crisply

scoringCriteria.excellent: Preempts top objections with clear, honest answers or next steps
scoringCriteria.poor: Defensive or evasive; creates new concerns

coachingTips: Offer proof or a follow-up plan

components.name: Environment Readiness & Professionalism
components.description: Polished, reliable setup that inspires confidence

subComponents.name: Environment Setup
subComponents.description: Clean data, right user role, bookmarks, and visuals

scoringCriteria.excellent: Zero distractions; production-like data and role; easy-to-read UI

subComponents.name: Technical Hygiene
subComponents.description: Stable audio/video, notifications off, backup plan ready

scoringCriteria.excellent: Flawless execution with backup environment ready

coachingTips: Keep a fallback deck or recording

components.name: Closing & Next Steps
components.description: Land value, confirm decisions, and secure concrete next actions

subComponents.name: Decision/Action Ask
subComponents.description: Explicitly ask for the decision or step the meeting was meant to enable

scoringCriteria.excellent: Clear ask aligned to success criteria with stakeholder owner/date
scoringCriteria.good: Asks for next step; ownership implied

subComponents.name: Mutual Action Plan
subComponents.description: Documented next steps with owners and dates

scoringCriteria.excellent: MAP captured live with owners, dates, and dependencies
scoringCriteria.fair: Informal next steps with no owners

coachingTips: Share the MAP artifact before leaving

components.name: Demo Crimes Avoidance
components.description: Avoid common demo mistakes that erode credibility and momentum

subComponents.name: No Feature Dumping
subComponents.description: Avoid unplanned tours and exhaustive configuration detours

scoringCriteria.excellent: No unplanned detours; every click has purpose
scoringCriteria.poor: Extended feature tour with no storyline

coachingTips: Script only the shortest winning path

subComponents.name: No Jargon/Navigation Crimes
subComponents.description: Minimize product jargon and confusing navigation

scoringCriteria.excellent: Plain language; clean navigation; no backtracking
